Slayton, looking at the spectacular Hawaiian view from the beach cottages at Kaneohe Marine Corps Air Station, where the Apollo astronauts and their families spent the first of 10 days together yesterday.

headline.main: There's No Show Like the Business Show

results.snippet: Every year, American business spends millions of dollars to produce shows which the public can't even pay to see. These "industrials", as all such live entertainments for industry are called, away not be good theater, but they do provide good jobs...
results.lead_paragraph: Every year, American business spends millions of dollars to produce shows which the public can't even pay to see. These "industrials", as all such live entertainments for industry are called, away not be good theater, but they do provide good jobs for hundreds of actors, as well as directors, choreographers, composers and musicians quick, certain money in a most uncertain business.

results.abstract: F M Esfandiary article on threshhold of age of limitless abundance of energy, food and raw materials; describes new sources of energy, new methods of food production and new accessibility of limitless raw materials; cites as 'short-sighted' exhortations to no-growth at time when world needs more growth not within but beyond industrialism; says people around world face scarcity not because of lack of resources but because of billions of dollars squandered on armaments; sketch (M)
results.snippet: The world is moving toward an age of limitless abundance abundant energy, food, raw materials. Decades from now this late 20th century will be remembered as a period in which the world shifted from age-old scarcity to a new era of plenty.
results.lead_paragraph: The world is moving toward an age of limitless abundance abundant energy, food, raw materials. Decades from now this late 20th century will be remembered as a period in which the world shifted from age-old scarcity to a new era of plenty.

results.abstract: Apollo astronaut Vance D Brand accepts blame for mishap that resulted in seepage of poison gas into spacecraft's cabin during re-entery into earth's atmosphere, news conf, Washington, DC: fellow crew member Brig Gen Thomas P Stafford says all 3 are to blame for incident since all should have known that special switches had not been activated; says communications noise might have contributed to error; crew and Apollo-Soyuz dir Dr Glynn Lunney receive NASA's Distinguished Service Medal from Pres Ford, who calls flight 'great triumph of science and tech'; present Ford with Presidential flag that was carried on mission; Ford promotes Stafford to Maj Gen; gas problem recalled; Brand illus (M)

headline.main: Stafford Says All 3 Astronauts Are at Fault in Apollo Gas Leak

results.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 (AP)  Vance D. Brand, the Apollo astronaut, took the blame, but Maj. Gen. Thomas P. Stafford said that all three crewmen must share responsibility for the mishap that let poison gas fumes into their spaceship as they returned to...
results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 (AP) Vance D. Brand, the Apollo astronaut, took the blame, but Maj. Gen. Thomas P. Stafford said that all three crewmen must share responsibility for the mishap that let poison gas fumes into their spaceship as they returned to earth July 24.

results.snippet: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Aug. 11 (UPI) Senator John H. Glenn Jr. of Ohio disavowed today all speculation that he would run as a favorite son Presidential candidate in the Democratic primary in Ohio, but the former astronaut left the door open for a spot on...
results.lead_paragraph: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Aug. 11 (UPI) Senator John H. Glenn Jr. of Ohio disavowed today all speculation that he would run as a favorite son Presidential candidate in the Democratic primary in Ohio, but the former astronaut left the door open for a spot on the national ticket in 1976.

headline.main: Notes on People; Stafford Is Leaving Astronauts

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: REVIEWS AND OTHER DATA ON SPECIFIC PRODUCTIONS

results.snippet: Maj. Gen. Thomas P. Stafford, the American commander for the Apollo-Soyuz mission last month, will leave the astronaut corps Nov. 1 after 13 years. The veteran of four spaceflights will return to active duty with the Air Force as commander of its...
results.lead_paragraph: Maj. Gen. Thomas P. Stafford, the American commander for the Apollo-Soyuz mission last month, will leave the astronaut corps Nov. 1 after 13 years. The veteran of four spaceflights will return to active duty with the Air Force as commander of its test-pilot training at Edwards, Air Force Base in California. General Stafford, a Naval Academy graduate, did his test-pilot training at Edwards and later headed its performance branch.

results.abstract: Lidiya Masterkova, Soviet artist who was 1 of organizers of 'unofficial' art exhibit in Sept, has applied to leave USSR and hopes to live in US; says her son Igor also applied to emigrate; sculptor Ernest Neizvestny was refused permission to leave in July; Dmitry Nalbandyan, author of work about 'unofficial' artists that appeared in Gonyok magazine, accuses artists of 'snobbish indifference to the labors and struggle of the people' (S)

headline.main: Notes on People; Sihanouk Back in Cambodia Next Month

results.snippet: The long-delayed return of Prince Norodom Sihanouk to Cambodia, ending five years of exile, has been set for Sept. 9 or 10, Peking sources said yesterday. Going with him, they said, will be his wife, Princess Monique, and two of his sons; Penn Nouth,...
results.lead_paragraph: The long-delayed return of Prince Norodom Sihanouk to Cambodia, ending five years of exile, has been set for Sept. 9 or 10, Peking sources said yesterday. Going with him, they said, will be his wife, Princess Monique, and two of his sons; Penn Nouth, the titular Cambodian premier, and his wife, and "perhaps" nvo or three others of the Prince's retinue-inexile of some 50 members.
